Reviews.Title: This post is about setting up a Nokia C2-01 on the AT&T; wireless network.
Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: So, this phone is NOT an AT&T; phone.  I bought it on Amazon.com for under $100.  At any rate, it boasts internet connectivity, email, app store, MMS, etc.  However, since it's not an AT&T; phone, it does not come pre-configured to connect to the AT&T; network for using these services.So, here are the Three steps required to get this phone going:Two of the Steps are configuring Access points, found under:Menu > Settings > Configuration > Personal config. sett. > Options > Add New >I will refer to the path above, as AP_HOME.1.  Configure Web Access PointGo to AP_HOME and choose Web and set it up as followsAccount name:  MediaNet (or whatever you want it to be)User name: (blank)Password: (blank)Use pref. access pt [Yes/No] (no)[If No] Access point settings -Proxy [Disabled/Enabled] Enabled-[If Enabled] Proxy Address wireless.cingular.com-[If Enabled] Proxy Port 80-Data bearer [Packet data/GSM data] Packet data -Bearer settings Packet data acc. pt: wap.cingularNetwork type [IPv4/IPv6] IPv4Authenticiation type [Normal/Secure] NormalUser name: (none)Password: (none)2.  Configure the MMS Access PointGo to AP_HOME and choose Multimedia msg.Account name: MMS (or whatever you want)Server address: http://mmsc.cingular.comUse pref. access pt [Yes/No] No[If No] Access point settings-Proxy [Disabled/Enabled] Enabled-[If Enabled] Proxy Address wireless.cingular.com-[If Enabled] Proxy Port 80-Bearer settingsPacket data acc. pt: wap.cingularNetwork type [IPv4/IPv6] IPv4Authenticiation type [Normal/Secure] NormalUser name: WAP@CINGULARGPRS.COM (all caps)Password: CINGULAR1 (all caps)3.  Set the default Access PointTo do this follow this pathMenu > Settings > ConfigurationIn configuration, choose Default config. sett.Choose "Personal config" and the middle button will now say "Details," so click the middle button.The middle button will now say "Default," click the middle button again.Congratulations, we just used the internet to solve a problem.

Reviews.Title: it is a very good phone.
Reviews.Author: t.k
Reviews.Content: I got the item on time,so far everything is working as it is supposed to. It is a very good phone.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Bat212
Reviews.Content: I had one of these for almost a year now. Has been through thick and thin. Had to order my dad one since most of his does not last 2 days. He has had this one since and its still going!!

Reviews.Title: Basic and functional / though not the weight and quality feel of earlier models.
Reviews.Author: J. Borst
Reviews.Content: I always equated Nokia with quality and have been loyal to the brand for 14-years.  After bad experiences with my last two purchases of much higher quality models (6700) this one works find and costs much less; but comes with a much cheaper look and feel.

Cellular Band - Quad-Band 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900 Mhz
Cellular Band 3G - 850 / 1900 / 2100 Mhz
